subject: Re: [junit] Re: How to enable/disable JUnit tests programatically ?
msgSnippet: ... I believe that the Spring situation will be completely resolved by Interceptors in 4.7.  If anyone s listening who cares about the combination, I d love to
messageBody:
On Thu, May 28, 2009 at 11:40 AM, mortench2004 <mortench2004@...> wrote:
> This is really a problem with the design of JUnit4. and not your filter (Spring has the same problem due to the Junit4 RunWith limitations). IMO this aspect of JUnit should be completely redesigned.

I believe that the Spring situation will be completely resolved by
Interceptors in 4.7. If anyone's listening who cares about the
combination, I'd love to hear if that's the case. If there are other
specific combinations that are not resolvable by Interceptors, I'd
also enjoy hearing about them.

David Saff
